underlying_goal: Understand the 'stealth mode' feature in the slack-mcp-server, its capabilities, and how it compares to standard OAuth methods.
primary_success: Provided an exceptionally clear and accurate breakdown of the differences between 'stealth mode' (xoxc/xoxd tokens), User OAuth (xoxp), and Bot OAuth (xoxb), including which capabilities (like search) work with each and the implications for channel access.
brief_summary: The user was curious about the 'stealth mode' feature. Claude investigated the code and provided a detailed explanation, clarifying that it uses browser session tokens to access an undocumented API. Through a series of follow-up questions, Claude expertly contrasted its capabilities with standard User and Bot OAuth tokens, explaining the crucial differences for features like search and channel access.
